method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the chopped cactus, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the pan.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cactus is tender.
In a separate pan, heat a tortilla until warm and pliable.
Spread a layer of black beans on one half of the tortilla.
Top with a layer of cooked cactus and shredded cheese.
Fold the tortilla in half to form a quesadilla.
Cook the quesadilla in the pan for 2 minutes on each side, until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is crispy.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling ingredients.
Serve the quesadillas hot, sliced into wedges.
Enjoy your Cactus and Black Bean Quesadillas!
